result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Hergert  #00342897, Christopher S

records.addlTxt:
10:04 AM Defendant Christopher S Hergert  #00342897 appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Ellen Anderson in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Matter set for Adj. INIT.     PD has not located an attorney for the DE as of this date.  DE stated he understood Court was appointing an attorney.   DE used profanity toward the court and got up and left the conference room at the Stanley Correctional Inst.     Employee of SCI indicated DE stated he was done with the hearing and he left the room.  DA reviewed prior minutes regarding court appointed attorney.  Court ordered a court appointed attorney for the DE.  Matter adjourned to 1-11-23 at 1:30 PM.  Adj. 10:09 AM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 11, 2023 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on January 11, 2023 at 01:30 pm.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report
CAME BACK AS DE REFUSED TO SIGN BOND
No contact with JRT and no contact with minors.

11:59 am Defendant Christopher S Hergert  #00342897 appeared by video.  Attorney Emily Nelson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Court calls the case, time set for Return on Warrant. State recites activity of the case, this case will need an Init App. State requests warrant be quashed, and a $5000.00 cash bond, no contact with JRT and no contact with minors.  DE states an Init App was held May 25th when he was in custody at which time he appeared without counsel.  State does not recall an Init App being set. 

Court explains the court process to DE. On file is an OSPD report that counsel has not yet been obtained.  Court will deny the Demand for Speedy Trial at this time.  DE believes it is his right to proceed without counsel, has written many letter to the court, believes it is a violation of his rights to not allow him to proceed w/o counsel. 

State addresses DE's demand for speedy trails and for dismissal of this case.  DE state's this case is affecting his cases that he is currently serving.  State suggests the court looks towards court appointed counsel.  DE does wish to have court appointed counsel.  Court appointed counsel will be searched for.  

Quash warrant.  $5000.00 cash bond, no contact with JRT and no contact with minors. Adj 12:17pm.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 27, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Demand for Speedy Trial made by DE
OSPD report. To date 214 attempts have been made to obtain counsel
